OMG!Finally!Welcomeback liquidhype!
Welcome back. Glad to see you again.
Thank you guys! Good to be back ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Welcome back! 

Is RSS/RO requires for some rockets? I tried to launch a vega but the first stage burned out after 22 seconds in stock KSP. IIRC it's supposed to burn for 2 minutes
Was the ATV ever finished ?

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Delta\_8930 said:
> 
> 
> Welcome back! 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Is RSS/RO requires for some rockets? I tried to launch a vega but the first stage burned out after 22 seconds in stock KSP. IIRC it's supposed to burn for 2 minutes
> 

When the next update hits, which probably won't be until KSP 1.1 it out, then all launch vehicles in this mod will require RSS/RO. I won't bother with "stockifying" them.

As of now, the mod is not downloadable (*though the old outdated version might still be up on KerbalStuff*). Last time I updated the mod, all launch vehicles had enough deltaV to get the proper sized payloads into orbit in both Stock KSP and in RSS. Each of the stages had their burntimes set to real world burntimes and stock 64% burntime respectively. If Vega's first stage only burned for 22 second, I don't know happened. I checked everything before I release the update a few months back.

In any case, each launch vehicle and its stages should all be configured properly as far as I can rememeber. I strongly recommend not downloading this mod in its current state unless you've got Realism Overhaul installed. To be honest, waiting for the next update would be the smart thing to do.

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, NateDaBeast said:
> 
> 
> Was the ATV ever finished ?
> 

Yes, the ATV was finished a long time ago. It was not released because I did not release Ariane 5. Ariane 5 and all of it's configurations are ready to be released, but I want to re-do the textures on all launch vehicles, and that can only happen once us modders get our hands on the new shaders from the 1.1 partTools. So until then, ATV and everything else will have to wait.

Well,but Im afraid 1.1 wont be that soon so is there any chance u can release a test version of Arine5&ATV？

> 
> 
> 21 minutes ago, mark7 said:
> 
> 
> Well,but Im afraid 1.1 wont be that soon so is there any chance u can release a test version of Arine5&ATV？
> 

1.1 not getting released any time soon is exactly why that is my self-set deadline, so to speak. I have been away for a few months now and need to get back into things. Check and re-check that everything is working properly. And I don't want a bunch of test versions of different launch vehicles floating around, as that is only going to result in people reporting incompability issues with different mods. Also if 1 or 2 people get test versions, then all of a sudden everyone wants a test version and I can be bothered dealing with having test versions on the lose.

Check and re-check that everything is working properly. And I don't want a bunch of test versions of different launch vehicles floating around, as that is only going to result in people reporting incompability issues with different mods. Also if 1 or 2 people get test versions, then all of a sudden everyone wants a test version and I can be bothered dealing with having test versions on the lose.

All right,  I get it.

Then we have to wait a couple weeks（or months Orz）……Anyway, Im SO looking forward ur next update, as always. And I wish u good luck！

I'll be looking for testers once it gets close to release, so I'll keep you in mind for that ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Anyways, thank you for that! I'll need it, as I'm currently working on Titan IVA/IVB, the entire Angara family, Soyuz ST, SeaLaunch and Vulcan. So I'll take all the good luck I can get.
Hey liquid! It's been a while! Good luck on Vulcan, they seem to change the paint job every couple of weeks! (Also, maybe add in the SMART reuse? I'd love to test it against RTLS)

you do know that there are easier ways to get the info than to worry.  I took time to speak to one of her friends, Tristonwilson and he told me the whole story.
Looks like they shrunk the first stage and made longer and slanted nose cones for the boosters.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, Delta\_8930 said:
> 
> 
> Looks like they shrunk the first stage and made longer and slanted nose cones for the boosters.
> 

Yes. I've known about it for a while, and have it fully modeled. But as it is just yet another artists impression of what it might look like, I won't bother including it in the mod. At least not until we have some more concrete information.
Glad to see you back ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Quick question-are you planning to make the GEM-63XL (based on Delta IV GEM-60) solid rocket boosters for the Vulcan? Apparently ULA switched out Aerojet Rocketdyne as a booster supplier and replaced it with Orbital ATK.
